Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
•   Tuition-free education: All tuition fees are covered for the duration of the program.
•   Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend of HUF 43,700 (approximately EUR 103) is provided for 12 months a year, continuing until the completion of the study program.
•   Accommodation Contribution: Scholarship holders are offered free dormitory placement or a contribution of HUF 40,000 per month towards accommodation costs.
•   Medical Insurance: Supplementary medical insurance is provided, covering costs up to HUF 65,000 (approximately EUR 160) annually.
•   Travel Costs: Travel costs to and from Hungary are covered.
Eligibility: Open to citizens from almost 80 countries, including Vietnam. Applicants must meet specific age, country, and residency requirements.
Eligible_Applicants:
•   Age Requirements: Applicants must be at least 18 years of age by August 31, 2025, at the latest. For doctoral (PhD) programs, applicants must be below 45 years of age.
•   Country Eligibility: Applicants must be citizens of an eligible Sending Partner country. The specific programs and number of applicants vary by country.
•   Residency: Scholarship holders must habitually reside in Hungary during their study period.
Eligible_Fields:
Degree Levels:
Bachelor’s, Master’s, One-Tier Master’s, Non-degree programs (e.g., preparatory courses), Doctoral programs, Postgraduate specialist training courses
Academic Fields:
Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance
Other_Requirements: A motivation letter is a mandatory application document. For scholarship extension, a minimum GPA of 4.0 ("Good") under Hungary's 5-point grading system is necessary. Specific university programs might have additional requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum is a prestigious scholarship program launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013, aimed at attracting top international students to pursue higher education in Hungary. It is officially managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and co-ordinated by Tempus Public Foundation.
Application_Documents:
Essential documents typically include:
•   Passport
•   Motivation Letter
•   English Proficiency Certificate
•   Educational documents (transcripts, diplomas from previous studies)
Further detailed information regarding required documents can be found in the official Application Guide.
Timeline:
Around mid-November 2024, confirmed open by November 27, 2024 : Application Opening Date
January 15, 2025, at 14:00 CET : Application Deadline
February 2025 : Nomination by Sending Partners
June 2025 : Final Results Announcement
September 2025 : Start of Studies in Hungary

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
- A €10,000 stipend to assist with living costs for one year.
- A full fee waiver for one year of study.
Eligibility: The GOI-IES targets outstanding non-EU/EEA students.
Eligible_Applicants:
- Nationality: Applicants must be citizens of countries other than the United Kingdom, Switzerland, the European Union, or the European Economic Area.
- Age Requirements: There is no age limit prescribed.
- Prior Scholarship Holding (for Research): Applicants applying for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. Similarly, applicants for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold or have previously held any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.
- Offer of Admission: Applicants must possess a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution at the time of applying for the GOI-IES scholarship.
Language_Certificate: English proficiency tests are generally a requirement for international students studying in Ireland. Applicants should consult their chosen Irish institution for specific English language requirements.
Awards_Requirement: Applicants applying for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. Similarly, applicants for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold or have previously held any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.
Other_Requirements:
- Reference Letters: Required, implied by "Guidance for Referees" document.
- Personal Statement: Typically required as part of the application process.
- Letter of Acceptance: A valid conditional or final offer letter from an Irish institution is mandatory at the time of application.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious initiative designed to attract high-calibre international students to pursue higher education in Ireland. It is funded by the Government of Ireland and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA).
Application_Documents:
- 2025 Call document
- FAQs
- Selection Process Infographic
- Guidance for Referees
- Application Help Document
- Indicative application form

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fees: The scholarship covers and waives tuition fees at Italian universities.
Monthly Allowance: Scholars receive a monthly allowance of 900 Euros, disbursed on a quarterly basis, to cover living expenses.
Health Insurance: The scholarship includes health insurance coverage.
Eligibility: Open to foreign students not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in their chosen Italian University/Institute.
Eligible_Applicants:
Foreign students not residing in Italy
Italian citizens living abroad (IRE)
Eligible_Fields:
Cultural, Scientific, and Technological areas
Higher Education for Fine Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs
Research activities
Advanced/short courses in Italian Language and Culture
Age: Under 28 for Master's/AFAM/Language courses; University-specific for Doctoral programs
Special_Circumstances: Students are permitted to work part-time in Italy, subject to local regulations and limits on working hours.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must secure admission to an Italian institution independently, as the scholarship application and university admission processes are separate.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, provided by MAECI, is a prestigious, fully funded initiative to attract talented international students and Italian citizens residing abroad for higher education in Italy, promoting cultural exchange and academic cooperation.
Application_Documents:
Specific list not provided; refer to official "Study in Italy" portal.
For PhD applicants: Letter of acceptance from an Italian university (mandatory).
Timeline:
May 2024 : Application Opening (for 2025-2026 academic year)
16 May 2025 : Application Deadline
01 November 2025 : Start of 9-month scholarships
31 July 2026 : End of 9-month scholarships
01 January 2026 : Start of 3-month scholarships
30 September 2026 : End of 3-month scholarships

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition Fee Coverage: Full tuition fee waiver for the duration of the scholarship. This includes coverage for the first year of bachelor's degree study and three years for master's degree study.
Living Stipend: A monthly stipend of up to CNY 2000, totaling ¥20,000 per year, to cover living expenses.
Accommodation: Free on-campus accommodation.
Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
Eligibility:
Nationality: Must be a non-Chinese citizen.
Health: Must be in good physical and mental health.
Academic Status: Applicants must be international students (foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD students) who are either currently enrolled or wish to enroll in a higher education institution in Tianjin.
Age Requirements: Master’s applicants: Must be under 35 years of age. PhD applicants: Must be under 40 years of age.
Work Requirements: No specific work experience requirements are mentioned for this scholarship.
Eligible_Applicants: International students (non-Chinese citizens) wishing to pursue undergraduate, master's, or PhD programs in Tianjin. It is open to both prospective students and current students at eligible institutions.
Eligible_Fields: Undergraduate, Master's, and PhD programs across various academic disciplines offered by Tianjin's higher education institutions.
Age: Under 35 for Master's, Under 40 for PhD
Career_Plan:
A comprehensive personal statement is required, which should include a study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths.
For Master and Doctor Degree applications: The statement should be no less than 800 words.
For Bachelor’s degree applications: The statement should be no less than 300 words.
The statement can be written in Chinese or English.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious program established by the Tianjin Municipal Government to attract outstanding international students to pursue higher education in China. It aims to immerse students in the vibrant academic and cultural atmosphere of Tianjin, one of China's largest and most rapidly growing cities, and a leading academic and innovation hub. The scholarship supports study at various higher education institutions within Tianjin, including prominent universities such as Tianjin University, Nankai University, and Tianjin Normal University.
Application_Documents:
1. Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form: To be completed via the online application system.
2. Admission Letter: An official admission letter from a Tianjin higher education institution. For PhD applicants, securing an acceptance letter from a Tianjin University professor is often a crucial step.
3. Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201).
4. Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy).
5. Passports: A copy of the applicant's passport with a validity period of six months or more.
6. Original No Crime Certificate.
7. Personal Statement: Including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, and strengths.
8. Language Proficiency Certificates: HSK-5 certificates with a minimum score of 180 (for Chinese-instructed programs); English Proficiency Certificates (for English-instructed programs).
9. Academic Transcripts and Diplomas: Bachelor/Master diplomas (or pre-graduation certificate if not yet graduated) and academic transcripts.
Timeline:
31/05/2025 : General Application Deadline
20/06/2025 : Tianjin University Application Deadline
30/06/2025 : Tianjin Normal University Application Deadline
01/07/2025 - 31/08/2025 : Admission results and documents sent to scholarship winners (e.g., by Tianjin University)

Funding_Details:
A comprehensive grant of €10,020 per academic year, coupled with a full tuition fee waiver.
The scholarship covers one academic year for Master's programmes comprising 60 ECTS credits, or two academic years for programmes of 120 ECTS credits.
Quantity: Globally: Approximately 30. Reserved: Japan: 3, Mexico: 3, Palestine: 2, USA: 5
Eligibility: Candidates must meet stringent academic and personal criteria to be considered for the Master Mind Scholarship.
Eligible_Applicants:
- Nationality: Open to outstanding international students from around the world.
- Age: Maximum 30 years old by the time of application.
- Work Experience: No specific professional work experience is required.
- Academic Performance: GPA of at least 3.5 out of 4.0.
- Required Degree: Previous degree (typically a Bachelor's degree) that qualifies for enrollment in a Master's programme at a Flemish higher education institution.
- Prior Flemish Study: Previous degree cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution (except for credit mobility students).
- Current Enrollment: Not eligible if already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution.
- Scholarship Combination: Cannot be combined with any other scholarship from the Flemish Government.
- Programme Exclusions: Certain Master's programmes may be excluded; verify with host institution.
Eligible_Fields: Eligible Master's programmes offered at participating Flemish higher education institutions in Flanders and Brussels. Applicants should consult the specific list of qualifying Master's programmes for the relevant academic year.
Special_Circumstances: The previous degree (used for Master's admission) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. However, international students who have previously undertaken credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) at a Flemish institution are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible to apply. The Master Mind scholarship cannot be combined with any other scholarship provided by the Flemish Government. Certain Master's programmes for the 2025-2026 academic year may be explicitly excluded from eligibility; applicants should verify this with their chosen host institution.
Career_Plan: A strong motivation letter is expected to articulate the applicant's academic and career aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors at the applicant's (previous) home university are required. An official letter of acceptance from the chosen Flemish host university is a prerequisite for the scholarship application.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship is a prestigious program offered by the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training, under the Government of Flanders. Its primary objective is to attract outstanding international students to pursue Master's degrees in Flanders and Brussels, thereby promoting the region as a top study destination.
Application_Documents:
- Master Mind Scholarship Application Form (mandatory)
- General required documents for Master's programme admission
- KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying via KU Leuven)
- Letter of motivation written in English
- Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of your (previous) home university
- An official letter of acceptance from the chosen Flemish host university is a prerequisite for the scholarship application.
Timeline:
Before January 15, 2025 (e.g., KU Leuven) : Apply for an eligible Master's programme and Master Mind Candidacy Form
January 15, 2025 (e.g., KU Leuven) : Deadline for Master's programme application and Master Mind Candidacy Form for 2025-2026 academic year
March 15, 2025 : General deadline for completing the Master Mind application form for 2025-2026 academic year
After application deadline : Host institution nominates eligible students
Following nomination : Host institution initiates scholarship application procedure by creating candidate's application file in Mobility-Online tool
Upon preselection : Candidate receives email notification generated by Mobility-Online tool

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Health Insurance
- Medical costs
- Tuition fees
- Visa expenses
- Living Expenses
- Monthly Stipend
Eligibility: Open to outstanding international students from all over the world for specialization, Master's, and PhD degree programs.
Eligible_Applicants:
- International students from all over the world.
- Not over 50 years of age.
- Must not have lived in Colombia within the past 6 months prior to applying.
- Must not have family or marital ties in Colombia.
- Must provide certification of good physical health.
- Minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA equivalent to 4.0 out of 5.0 on the Colombian grading scale.
- Hold a Bachelor's degree (or equivalent undergraduate-licentiate).
- Admitted to at least one (and up to three) eligible Master's programs from the 2025-2 academic catalogue.
- English proficiency required (IELTS 7.0, TOEFL iBT 95, or Duolingo 130, among others).
Eligible_Fields:
Degree Programs: Specialization, Master's, PhD
Priority Areas: Scientific research, Technology, Innovation
Special_Circumstances:
- Must not have lived in Colombia within the past 6 months prior to applying.
- Must not have family or marital ties in Colombia.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship is a fully funded program for outstanding international students, provided by ICETEX, covering a wide range of expenses for specialization, Master's, and PhD degree programs in Colombia.
Timeline:
Before 13 June 2025 : Complete online application on ICETEX platform
24 June 2025 : Final Application Deadline

Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses:
*   Travel expenses
*   Accommodation
*   Subsistence expenses
Exclusions (NOT Covered):
*   Costs associated with pre-existing illnesses
*   Dental treatment
*   Brain disease
*   Mental illness
*   Pregnancy
*   Glasses
Awardees are advised that these specific medical and personal costs are not covered by the scholarship.
Quantity: Globally: 70 postgraduate scholarships annually; Africa: 173 participants since 2015
Eligibility: Primarily targeted at government officials from developing countries. Applicants must be in good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant. Part-time employment is strictly prohibited. Conflicting information exists regarding eligible nationalities (Thai citizens vs. not Thai citizens) and age limits (under 45 vs. under 50). Applicants must refer to official TICA list and program announcements for definitive information.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Government officials from developing countries, including some OIC Member States, African countries, Cambodia, Lao PDR, Myanmar, and Vietnam.
*   An official "List of Eligible Countries/Territories" is maintained on the TICA website.
*   Conflicting Information on Nationality: Some sources indicate Thailand is an eligible country, while others explicitly state applicants must *not* be Thai citizens. Applicants are advised to refer to official TICA list.
*   Conflicting Information on Age: Candidates must be no more than 45 years of age, while others indicate applicants must be under 50 years of age. Applicants should verify the specific age limit.
*   Civil servants applying must fulfill all relevant criteria prescribed by their respective country's civil service regulations.
*   Candidates must be in good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant.
*   Part-time employment is strictly prohibited during the scholarship period.
Eligible_Fields:
Master of Arts Program in Tourism and Hospitality Management
Climate Change and Environmental Issues
Agriculture and Food Security
Public Health
Sufficiency Economy
Age: Under 50 (conflicting information, some sources state no more than 45)
Other_Requirements: Candidates are permitted to choose only one course or program. Awardees are required to study full-time. Awardees are not allowed to change their program topic or study plan once awarded.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a significant initiative under Thailand's international development cooperation, offering Master's degree scholarships to government officials from developing countries. Administered by the Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA) and the Royal Thai Government in collaboration with Thai universities, TIPP aims to foster human resource development and strengthen partnerships. Established in 2000, the program provides comprehensive funding for selected postgraduate studies in critical development areas.
Application_Documents:
*   A standard application form is required.
*   Two completed application forms are typically needed.
*   The application form can often be downloaded from relevant Ministry websites in eligible countries.
Timeline:
2000 : Program established
Since 2015 : 173 African participants awarded TIPP scholarships
22/01/2025 : Application Deadline (as announced by the Royal Thai Embassy for some programs)
31/01/2025 : Application Deadline for TIPP 2025 (as per some sources)
31/05/2025 : Application Deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year (as per some announcements)
23/06/2025 : Next application round opens
10/10/2025 : Next application round closes

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides complete financial coverage for bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degrees.
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Living allowances
*   Monthly stipends
*   Travel expenses (including air tickets)
*   Health insurance
*   Hostel accommodation
*   Book allowance
*   Visas
Eligibility: Applicants must be from developing countries or countries with bilateral ties with Indonesia.
Eligible_Applicants: International students from developing countries (e.g., Thailand, Fiji, Gambia, Senegal, Nigeria, Malawi, and other NAM member countries) and countries with bilateral ties with Indonesia.
Other_Requirements: Each study program at participating universities may have different requirements. For example, the KNB Scholarship at Universitas Brawijaya is provided exclusively for Master’s and Doctoral Degree Programs, not Bachelor's. Minimum GPA for Master's and higher degrees is 3.00.
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship is a prestigious and fully funded scholarship program offered by the Indonesian government. It is designed to provide full financial support to international students from developing countries, as well as those with bilateral ties with Indonesia, to pursue higher education in Indonesia. The scholarship aims to nurture future leaders by offering an experience of studying at top Indonesian universities.
Application_Documents:
Recommendation Letters:
*   Recommendation letter from a supervisor from one of the research universities which is a partner of the KNB scholarship.
*   Academic recommendation letter from their respective universities.
*   Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General.
*   Recommendation letter in English or Bahasa from the potential research supervisor in one of the universities.
Required Application Documents:
*   Scholarship Guide (downloadable from the official website)
*   Scanned degree certificate (Bachelor's for Master's applicants, Master's for Doctorate applicants)
*   Health Certificate (must be signed by a licensed doctor)
*   Documents mentioning education background, achievements, and work experience.
Timeline:
17 February 2025 : Application Opening Date
21 March 2025 : Application Deadline
26 February – 22 March 2024 : Selection Dates (for a previous cycle)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The RTP Scholarships are fully funded, covering both PhD (Doctoral) and Master's research degrees. The funding package is comprehensive, providing significant financial support to recipients.

Covered Expenses:
*   Stipend: A living allowance paid fortnightly. The annual rate varies by university and year, and is indexed annually.
*   Tuition Fees (Fee Offset): 100% coverage of tuition fees for the duration of the scholarship. For international students, this is often automatically awarded alongside the RTP Stipend.
*   Relocation Allowance: Financial assistance for relocation costs. For example, the University of the Sunshine Coast (UniSC) offers up to A$2,000. The University of Sydney also mentions a relocation allowance.
*   Thesis Allowance: Financial support for costs associated with thesis production.
*   Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC): Provided for international students.

Stipend Rates (Examples):
*   A$41,753 per annum (2025 rate, University of Sydney)
*   A$36,225 per annum (2025 rate, University of Canberra)
*   A$34,752 annually (ACIR)
*   A$33,511 per annum (full-time, Australian Catholic University)
*   A$28,854 per annum (2022 rate, reported via Facebook)
Quantity: Not specified, as scholarships are allocated to universities by the Australian Government, and universities then award them competitively.
Eligibility: Open to both domestic and international students who are commencing or currently enrolled in a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) program at an Australian university.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Domestic students
*   International students
*   Commencing or currently enrolled in a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) program at an Australian university
*   Full-time and part-time candidates (pro-rata stipend for part-time)
Awards_Requirement: RTP Scholarships are highly competitive and are awarded based on academic merit and research potential.
Special_Circumstances: Australian Government Research Training Program Indigenous Priority Scheme Scholarships offer a maximum of 4 years for a full-time Doctoral Degree (Research).
Other_Requirements:
*   Applicants must demonstrate high-achieving academic results in their prior studies, typically including a bachelor's degree with first-class honours or qualifications deemed equivalent by the admitting university.
*   Relevant research experience deemed equivalent by the university may also be considered.
*   Applicants must demonstrate a willingness and capacity to establish effective supervisory support.
*   Applicants are ranked by relevant selection panels based on their academic results for prior study and their research potential in their chosen field.
*   Applications are made directly through individual Australian universities.
Scholarship_Info: The Australian Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are a prestigious initiative funded by the Australian Government (Commonwealth Government). These scholarships are designed to support both domestic and international students undertaking Higher Degree by Research (HDR) programs in Australia. The program aims to foster high-quality research and innovation across Australian universities. Universities administer the scholarships, integrating them into their broader postgraduate research offerings.
Application_Documents: Applicants will need to submit academic transcripts, research proposals, and potentially other supporting documents as required by the specific university's application process.
Timeline: 01/09/2025 : Applications open for 2026 RTP stipend scholarships at Federation University

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition fees
International flights
Monthly allowance
Medical insurance
Visa & registration
Eligibility: Applicants must be citizens of Member States of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) and Member States of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM), meet specific age requirements for their chosen study level, possess a minimum GPA of 70% or equivalent (3.0 on a 4.0 scale), have a valid educational background, and demonstrate language proficiency.
Eligible_Applicants:
Citizens of Member States of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC)
Citizens of Member States of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM)
Examples: Antigua and Barbuda, Egypt, Barbados, Belize, Venezuela, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brunei Darussalam, Burkina Faso
Age: Under 25 for Bachelor's and General Medicine; Under 30 for Master's; Under 40 for PhD
Other_Requirements:
All applicants with foreign qualifications must have their documents officially equated.
Applicants must demonstrate language proficiency in English, Russian, Turkish, or Azerbaijani, depending on the language of instruction for their chosen program.
A selected applicant is considered a scholarship recipient only after delivering the required documentation to the offices of the higher education institution in the Republic of Azerbaijan and agreeing to the commitments of the Scholarship Program.
Scholarship_Info: The Azerbaijan Government Scholarship, officially known as the 'Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program,' is a prestigious, fully funded initiative by the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan. It supports the education of foreign citizens in Azerbaijani higher education institutions across Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, General Medicine/Residency, and Preparatory courses, honoring the legacy of Heydar Aliyev.
Application_Documents:
Valid passport copy
Recent medical certificate (must include HIV/AIDS and Hepatitis B/C test results)
Motivation letter
Proof of Language Proficiency
Academic transcripts and diplomas (to demonstrate required educational background and academic achievements)
Timeline:
15/03/2025 : Application Opening Date
15/05/2025 : Application Deadline (First Stage)
16/05/2025 to 31/05/2025 : Review and Evaluation by Government Authorities (First Stage)
01/06/2025 to 20/06/2025 : Registration of Applications in SIACAS (Second Stage)
20/06/2025 to 15/07/2025 : Review and Evaluation of Candidates (Second Stage)
16/07/2025 to 31/07/2025 : Notification of Selected Candidates
15/09/2025 : Start of Academic Year
30/09/2025 : Last Date for Arrival in Azerbaijan

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides significant financial assistance to cover expenses during the scholarship period.
*   Monthly Scholarship Amount:
    *   Up to €1,025 monthly for general scholarship holders.
    *   Specifically, €1,025.50 for PhD students.
    *   Some sources indicate up to $1,800 for students, though the primary currency mentioned is Euros.
*   Covered Expenses: The scholarship is intended to cover international scholarship holders' living costs in Slovakia and includes travel allowances.
*   Application Fee: No application fee is required to apply for the NSP Scholarship.
Quantity: Multiple scholarships are awarded per application round.
Eligibility: The scholarship is open to a wide range of international applicants, with specific conditions regarding nationality and age. Citizens of various countries can apply, including but not limited to Vietnam, the Republic of South Africa, and Thailand.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Students
*   PhD Candidates
*   University Teachers
*   Researchers
*   Artists
Eligible_Fields:
Teacher Training and Education Science
Economics
Natural Sciences
Technical Sciences
Medicine
Agriculture Sciences
Social Sciences
Humanities
Arts
Special_Circumstances: Applicants under 18 years old require a hand-signed approval from their legal guardian.
Other_Requirements: Applicants specifically for Bachelor's or Master's degrees must be at least 18 years old by September 1st of the application year to be eligible.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme (NSP) of the Slovak Republic is a prestigious initiative funded by the Ministry of Education, Science, Research and Sport of the Slovak Republic. It aims to support the mobility of foreign students, PhD candidates, university teachers, researchers, and artists for study, research, teaching, or artistic stays in Slovakia. The program offers substantial financial support covering living costs and travel allowances, with no application fee.
Application_Documents: All applications and required attachments must be submitted in either Slovak or English.
Timeline:
At least six weeks prior to each deadline : Online application system opens
30/04/2025 : Application Deadline
31/10/2025 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation
Funding_Details:
The scholarship offers both full and partial scholarships, categorized into three types, with the highest award reaching 40,000 RMB (approximately US$5,700) per recipient annually.

Scholarship Coverage:
*   Tuition fees (full or half of the tuition fee)
*   Accommodation fees (for specific university scholarships, e.g., University of Science and Technology Beijing Scholarship)
*   Living allowance (for specific university scholarships, e.g., University of Science and Technology Beijing Scholarship)

Annual Funding Amounts (Full Scholarship):
*   Doctoral Degree Students: RMB 40,000 per year
*   Master's Degree Students: RMB 30,000 per year
*   Bachelor's Degree Students (Undergraduates): RMB 20,000 per year
*   Senior Scholars / Long-term Language Students: RMB 10,000 per year
Eligibility: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens/nationals, in good health, and either already admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student at a Beijing university or applying to an eligible institution.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Non-Chinese citizens/nationals
*   In good health
*   Already admitted as an undergraduate or graduate student at a Beijing university (e.g., Peking University) or applying to an eligible institution
*   Prospective and current international students
Eligible_Fields:
General academic programs (bachelor's, master's, doctoral degrees)
Long-term language courses
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Relevant Master's degree
Academic_Certificate: High-School Certificate, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Age: Under 30 (Undergraduate, general), Under 50 (Undergraduate, specific programs), Under 35 (Master's)
Career_Plan: Elements often included in Statement of Purpose
Other_Requirements: Admission to an eligible university in Beijing is often a prerequisite or a concurrent requirement for the scholarship application.
Scholarship_Info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS) is a prestigious financial aid program established by the Beijing Government to attract outstanding international students to study in Beijing, China. It aims to promote international educational exchange and foster talent development within the city's higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
*   Statement of Purpose (clearly indicating duration and purpose of study, preferred technical work or experience, and academic background)
*   Two letters of recommendation
*   Other academic transcripts, certificates, and personal identification documents as required by the host institution.
Timeline:
Currently open : Application window
End of February (Fall intake) : General Application Deadline
December 20, 2024 (Spring intake) : Application Deadline (e.g., BFSU)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Full tuition fees.
- Accommodation in student dormitories.
- Monthly stipend.
- Medical assistance in case of emergencies.
- Local public transport discounts.
- No application fee is required.
- A preparatory year for Romanian language study is granted for candidates who do not speak Romanian, prior to enrolling in their chosen university studies (except for doctoral scholarship holders who opt for a foreign language program).
Quantity: 85 scholarships for undergraduate, master's, and PhD studies
Eligibility: Open to non-EU citizens, with age limits for different study levels, requiring strong academic merit, and adherence to academic and disciplinary standards.
Eligible_Applicants:
- Nationality: Open to non-EU citizens.
- Age Requirements:
    - Under 35 years old for Bachelor's and Master's studies.
    - Under 45 years old for PhD studies.
- Academic Merit: Applicants must demonstrate strong academic merit, with good results in education.
- General Conduct: Scholarship recipients are expected to maintain academic commitment (attendance of at least 80% of all lectures and activities) and adhere to disciplinary standards.
Eligible_Fields:
Eligible: Engineering & Technology, Social Sciences, Arts, Humanities (all fields except restricted ones)
Restricted: Medicine, Dental Medicine, Pharmacy
Required_Degree: Bachelor's equivalent, Bachelor's degree, Relevant Master's degree, Final Year Student
Language_Certificate: Romanian language proficiency B1, TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR
Age: Under 35 for Bachelor's/Master's, Under 45 for PhD
Other_Requirements: Maintain academic commitment (attendance of at least 80% of all lectures and activities) and adhere to disciplinary standards.
Scholarship_Info: The Romanian Government Scholarship, officially provided by the Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA), is a prestigious, fully funded opportunity for international students from non-EU countries to pursue higher education in Romania. This scholarship aims to promote Romanian language and culture while fostering academic excellence across various fields of study at Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD levels. It covers a wide range of expenses, making it an attractive option for students seeking to study in a European education system without financial burden.
Application_Documents:
Core Documents:
- Curriculum Vitae (CV).
- Motivation letter.
- Letters of recommendation.

Academic Documents:
- Copies of diplomas or degrees (high school, Bachelor's, Master's, as applicable).
- Academic transcripts for all previously completed study years.
- Certificate proving final year of studies and graduation exam (if applicable, along with the transcript of academic record until the moment of application).

Personal Documents:
- Birth certificate or equivalent document.
- Copy of passport or national ID (first 3 pages).
- Medical certificate attesting to the candidate's good health.

Language Proficiency Proof (if applicable):
- Certificate of Romanian language proficiency (level B1 or equivalent), if already possessed.
- Other language certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR) for non-Romanian programs, particularly for PhD studies.

Translation Requirements:
- Authorized translation into English, French, Spanish, or Romanian for all documents not originally in one of these languages.
Timeline:
29/01/2025 : Application Opening Date
12/03/2025 : Application Deadline
30/06/2025 : Result Announcement
01/10/2025 : Start of Academic Year

Scholarship_Name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers both tuition fees and living expenses.
*   Tuition Fees: Directly paid to the Swedish university.
*   Living Expenses: Regular payments of SEK 12,000 per month are provided to cover living costs throughout the scholarship period.
Quantity: Approximately 350 scholarships are awarded annually. For example, 357 applicants were selected for the 2024/2025 academic year, and 299 for 2023/2024.
Eligibility: Applicants must meet several stringent criteria to be considered for the SISGP scholarship.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Citizenship: Applicants must hold citizenship from one of the eligible countries (e.g., 33 or 42 countries). Citizens of EU/EEA countries are generally not the target group.
*   Age Requirements: The scholarship is open to everyone aged 18 and above.
*   Work Experience: A minimum of 3,000 hours of demonstrated employment is required.
*   Academic Background: Applicants must have completed a Bachelor's degree and be admitted to an eligible Master's programme in Sweden.
Eligible_Fields: Master's programmes specifically listed as eligible for the SI scholarship.
Other_Requirements: Applicants should submit only one scholarship application in the SI application portal, regardless of how many Master's programmes they have applied for at University Admissions, Stockholm School of Economics, or Konstfack.
Scholarship_Info: The Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program provided by the Swedish Institute, an agency under the Swedish Government. It is designed for international students wishing to pursue Master's programmes in Sweden. The scholarship aims to develop future global leaders who can contribute to the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.
Application_Documents: The specific list of SI Scholarship application documents (which may include reference letters, a career plan, and other supporting materials) is published on the official SI website, usually in mid-November for the upcoming academic year.
Timeline:
Mid-November 2025 : SI Scholarship application documents and the list of eligible Master's programmes are published
09/02/2026 : Application portal for the SI Scholarships opens
25/02/2026 : Application Deadline
26/03/2026 : University Admissions Results announced
After 26 March 2026 : Scholarship Evaluation by Swedish Institute

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The GKS is a fully funded scholarship, significantly reducing the financial burden on recipients. The comprehensive benefits package includes:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of university tuition.
*   Monthly Living Allowance: An all-inclusive subsidy to cover living expenses.
*   Airfare: Round-trip air tickets to and from South Korea.
*   Medical Insurance: Health and medical insurance coverage.
*   On-Campus Housing: Provision for on-campus accommodation.
Quantity: Undergraduate: 280 (Embassy Track: 150 (General: 82, Overseas Koreans: 7, R-GKS: 61), University Track: 130). Graduate (Master's and PhD): 600. (Note: Another source indicates a total of 367 undergraduate awards).
Eligibility:
The GKS program is open to a broad international applicant pool with specific requirements:
*   Eligible Nationalities: All nationalities are eligible to apply.
*   Age Requirements: For the 2025 GKS-G (Graduate program), applicants must be under 40 years of age (born after September 1, 1985).
*   Degree Requirements: Applicants must have obtained or be expected to obtain the required degree for their chosen program (e.g., high school diploma for undergraduate, Bachelor's for Master's, Master's for PhD). Applicants with provisional graduation certificates may apply but must submit their official certificate by a specified deadline (e.g., December 31st, 2025, for 2026 GKS-U).
Eligible_Applicants: All nationalities are eligible to apply.
Eligible_Fields: All fields of study offered by participating universities in South Korea.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants with provisional graduation certificates can apply but must submit their official certificate by a specified deadline (e.g., December 31st, 2025, for 2026 GKS-U).
Career_Plan: Required as part of Study Plan (Form 3) outlining academic and career goals.
Other_Requirements:
*   Reference Letters: One letter of Recommendation (Form 5) is mandatory and must be signed and sealed by the recommender.
*   Study Plan: A detailed Study Plan (Form 3) outlining academic and career goals is a required component of the application.
*   Personal Statement: A Personal Statement (Form 2) is also required.
*   Research Proposal: For applicants to Research Programs, a Research Proposal (Form 4) is necessary.
Scholarship_Info: The Global Korea Scholarship (GKS), provided by the Korean Government through the National Institute for International Education (NIIED), is a highly competitive and fully funded scholarship program designed to offer international students the opportunity to pursue higher education in South Korea. It covers a wide range of academic programs, including undergraduate, Master's, and PhD degrees, across all fields of study offered by participating Korean universities. The scholarship aims to foster global education exchange and strengthen international ties.
Application_Documents:
Applicants are generally required to submit one set of original documents along with three sets of simple photocopies (one-sided copies), typically including:
*   Applicant Form (Form 1)
*   Personal Statement (Form 2)
*   Study Plan (Form 3)
*   Research Proposal (Form 4) (only for Research Program applicants)
*   One Letter of Recommendation (Form 5) (must be signed and sealed by the recommender)
*   Official graduation certificate (or diploma)
*   Final academic transcript
*   Certificates of Employment or Working Experience (optional)
*   Other supporting documents as specified in the guidelines
*   GPA conversion table
Timeline:
Typically September : Application period opens
September 15, 2026 : Undergraduate Application Opening Date
October 31, 2026 : Undergraduate Application Deadline (General Track)
September 30, 2026 : Undergraduate Application Deadline (Embassy Track)
December 31st, 2025 : Deadline for provisional graduates to submit official certificates (for 2026 GKS-U)
